did.abstract: Richard D. McLellan is a Michigan lawyer and government policy specialist. He has been actively engaged in government service and was an important advocate in Michigan’s school choice movement. The collection documents his work with TEACH Michigan, an organization established to amend Michigan’s constitution to allow use of school vouchers and increase the number of charter schools in the state. Also material related to speeches and remarks made on various subjects.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Richard D. McLellan (donor no. 10744) in March 2012 and September 2013.

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Richard D. McLellan papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Richard D. McLellan was born in Paw Paw, Michigan. He graduated from Michigan State University in 1964 with a bachelor's degree in advertising. He earned his law degree from the University of Michigan Law School in 1967.

McLellan began his legal career as a lawyer in Fowlerville, Michigan where he also served as Chief Assistant Prosecuting Attorney for Livingston County, Michigan. In 1969 he joined the staff of Governor William G. Milliken where he served as an administrative assistant for policies and programs until 1973.

In 1973, McLellan launched a private law practice in Lansing, Michigan that grew into the lawyer firm of McLellan, Schlaybaugh and Whitbeck. The firm combined practices with Dykema, Gossett, Spencer, Goodnow & Trigg in 1982 where McLellan practiced until retiring in 2007. During his tenure at Dykema, McLellan served as head of the firm's Government Policy & Practice Group and as Managing Member of the firm's Lansing Office. He also served a term on the firm's Executive Committee.

In addition to his professional activities, McLellan has also accepted a variety of government service responsibilities: as both member and chair of the Michigan Law Revision Commission and as a member of the National Advisory Food and Drug Committee of the U.S. Department of Health, Education and Welfare.

McLellan was also involved in efforts to expand school choice for Michigan students. He drafted bipartisan legislation establishing charter schools as part of Michigan's system of free public schools. He also represented parties supporting the law after it was challenged by the Michigan Education Association and successfully argued in the Michigan Supreme Court the key decision upholding charter schools as constitutionally-established public schools.

scopecontent.p: The McLellan collection documents McLellan's work with TEACH Michigan, the organization established to support school choice measures in Michigan. These measures included a proposed amendment to Michigan's constitution to permit the use of school vouchers and to increase the number of charter schools operating in the state. The TEACH Michigan series has been arranged in the following subseries: Background, Charter Schools, Constitutional Amendment, Correspondence, Legislation, and Organizational Files.

The series documents McLellan's work with TEACH Michigan, the organization established to support school choice measures in Michigan. These measures included a proposed amendment to Michigan's constitution to permit the use of school vouchers and to increase the number of charter schools operating in the state. The TEACH Michigan series has been arranged in the following subseries: Background, Charter Schools, Constitutional Amendment, Correspondence, Legislation, and Organizational Files.
Background contains research relating to school choice and cases involving school voucher programs in other states.

did.unittitle: Appellate Opinions Up for Review in 1993

scopecontent.p: Charter Schools contains research related to charter school programs and information related to the institution of charter schools within Michigan.

did.unittitle: Huron State University and Metropolitan Charter School

scopecontent.p: The Constitutional Amendment subseries includes drafts of the proposed constitutional amendment, in addition to correspondence and memos relating to the drafting process.

Correspondence includes mailings from the Michigan Department of Education, letters from officers of the Mackinac Center sent to RDM for his information, communications with Paul N. DeWeese, president of Michigan Citizens for Choice in Education (later renamed TEACH Michigan), and from George E. Ward, trustee of Saginaw Valley State University.

Legislation includes copies of bills proposed in the Michigan House and Senate related to school choice. Also included are McLellan's communications with Michigan legislators about proposed legislation.

The Organizational Files consist of communications with, and collected material from, organizations who were working for educational reform. These organizations include the Michigan Center for Charter Schools and TEACH Michigan. Many of these communications are with Paul N. DeWeese.

scopecontent.p: The series, Speeches Remarks, Comments, includes texts, talking points and outlines, correspondence, background information, meeting agenda, and material related to speeches and remarks made by McLellan on various subjects, between 1987 and 2012. Material in this series is organized chronologically and includes a donor-prepared item list with events' exact dates, places, and additional notes. Topics include domestic and international trade and business, politics, government, education, ethics, institutional change, among others.
